item.title: mazzo.li — Backing up WhatsApp data through the multi-device web client
item.description: Systematically backing up WhatsApp messages and media in an open format is impractical. However the multi-device beta makes the WhatsApp web client an almost first-class WhatsApp client. I describe how the web client stores messages and media, and a proof of concept program, `wadump`, which can extract and display them.
item.author: (Francesco Mazzoli <f@mazzo.li>)

item.title: Debian's which hunt
item.description: One does not normally expect to see a great deal of angst over a one-page shell script, even on the Internet. But Debian is special, so it has been having an extended discussion over the fate of the which command that has been escalated to the Debian Technical Committee. The amount of attention that has been given to a small, nonstandard utility shines a light on Debian's governance processes and the interaction of tradition with standards.
item.author: (By Jonathan CorbetOctober 28, 2021)

item.title: Anti-Pattern: Don't modify Optimizely CMS (Episerver) content objects in the Controller
item.description: Using your content object (CurrentPage / CurrentBlock) as a makeshift viewmodel where you change settings or extend it with user data in the controller before passing it to the view, is unfortunately (and to my surprise) a pretty wide-spread practice among developers implementing Optimizely (Episerver) web sites. But it really needs to stop.
item.author: (Allan Thraen)
